publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-4739.1 Brian Adam: Broadband in Rural Scotland—As an amendment to motion (S2M-4739) in the name of Dave Petrie, leave out from second "many" to end and insert "significant numbers of rural and urban communities throughout Scotland, including Kingswells in Aberdeen, not yet covered by this programme, who have no access to the broadband network, and urges the Executive to stick to its commitment to improve access throughout Scotland and speed up the ongoing technical assessments into the matter and engage with Ofcom to overcome any competition and other regulatory impediments." Motions and amendments which have attracted additional support

S2M-4739.1 Broadband in Rural Scotland (lodged on 4 September 2006) Rob Gibson*, Ms Sandra White*, Jim Mather*, Ms Maureen Watt*, Roseanna Cunningham*, Fergus Ewing*, Bruce Crawford*, Richard Lochhead*
S2M-4739.1 Broadband in Rural Scotland (lodged on 4 September 2006) Nora Radcliffe*

S2M-4739.1 Brian Adam: Broadband in Rural Scotland—As an amendment to motion (S2M-4739) in the name of Dave Petrie, leave out from second "many" to end and insert "significant numbers of rural and urban communities throughout Scotland, including Kingswells in Aberdeen, not yet covered by this programme, who have no access to the broadband network, and urges the Executive to stick to its commitment to improve access throughout Scotland and speed up the ongoing technical assessments into the matter and engage with Ofcom to overcome any competition and other regulatory impediments." Supported by: Rob Gibson, Ms Sandra White, Jim Mather, Ms Maureen Watt, Roseanna Cunningham, Fergus Ewing, Bruce Crawford, Richard Lochhead, Nora Radcliffe, Shiona Baird*
S2M-4739.1 Broadband in Rural Scotland (lodged on 4 September 2006) Dr Jean Turner*
